alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 07 at 10:10AM AKST until November 09 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow, blowing snow, heavy snow, and mixed precipitation possible. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A major winter storm could bring a variety of weather to the Matanuska Valley tonight through Thursday. There is a chance for a brief period of light snow late tonight through early Tuesday morning. Northeast winds gusting 25 to 40 mph through the Palmer and Wasilla areas will result in blowing snow and low visibilities if it does snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
